Package patreon.java

Class PatreonAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • patreon.java.PatreonAPI
  • public class PatreonAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of the Patreon API. You only need one of these.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • BASE_URI

        public static final java.lang.String BASE_URI
        The base URI for requests to the Patreon API. This may be overridden (e.g. for testing) by passing -Dpatreon.rest.uri="https://my.other.server.com" as JVM arguments. The default URL is "https://www.patreon.com".

    • Constructor Detail

      • PatreonAPI

        public PatreonAPI​(java.lang.String accessToken)
        Create a new instance of the Patreon API. You only need one of these objects unless you are using the API with multiple tokens
        Parameters:
        accessToken - The "Creator's Access Token" found on the patreon client page OR OAuth access token

               throws java.io.IOException

        the authenticated user
        Throws:

        public java.util.List<Campaign> fetchCampaigns()
                                        throws java.io.IOException

        a list of campaigns

      • fetchCampaign

        public Campaign fetchCampaign​(java.lang.String campaignID)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the campaign specified by it's ID.
        Parameters:
        campaignID - the ID for the campaign
        Returns:
        the campaign specified by it's ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails

      • fetchMembers

        public com.github.jasminb.jsonapi.JSONAPIDocument<java.util.List<Member>> fetchMembers​(java.lang.String campaignID,
                                                                                       boolean pledgeEvents)
                                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list of members from the specified campaign. If you request pledge events, the list will only contain 500 members. Otherwise, it will contain 1000 members. If you exceed these numbers, you will need to use the pagination meta to get the rest of your members.
        Parameters:
        campaignID - the ID for the campaign
        pledgeEvents - request pledge history for each member
        Returns:
        a list of members from the specified campaign
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails
        See Also:
        fetchPageOfMembers(String, boolean, int, String)

      • fetchPageOfMembers

        public com.github.jasminb.jsonapi.JSONAPIDocument<java.util.List<Member>> fetchPageOfMembers​(java.lang.String campaignID,
                                                                                             boolean pledgeEvents,
                                                                                             int pageSize,
                                                                                             java.lang.String cursor)
                                                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list of members from the specified campaign. This is made for use with the pagination meta if your previous response didn't contain all of your members. If this response doesn't contain all of your members, it may also have some pagination meta.
        Parameters:
        campaignID - the ID for the campaign
        pledgeEvents - request pledge history for each member
        pageSize - the number of members to request
        cursor - the next cursor from the pagination meta
        Returns:
        a list of members from the specified campaign
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails

      • fetchMember

        public Member fetchMember​(java.lang.String memberID)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a member specified by their member ID. Pledge events are requested by default.
        Parameters:
        memberID - the ID for the member
        Returns:
        a member specified by their member ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails

      • fetchPosts

        public com.github.jasminb.jsonapi.JSONAPIDocument<java.util.List<Post>> fetchPosts​(java.lang.String campaignID)
                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list of posts from the specified campaign. Patreon's API documentation doesn't say how many posts are in a response. If this response doesn't contain all of your posts, you will need to use the pagination meta to get the rest of your posts.
        Parameters:
        campaignID - the ID for the campaign
        Returns:
        a list of posts from the campaign
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails
        See Also:
        fetchPageOfPosts(String, int, String)

      • fetchPageOfPosts

        public com.github.jasminb.jsonapi.JSONAPIDocument<java.util.List<Post>> fetchPageOfPosts​(java.lang.String campaignID,
                                                                                         int pageSize,
                                                                                         java.lang.String cursor)
                                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list of posts from the specified campaign. This is made for use with the pagination meta if your previous response didn't contain all of your posts. If this response doesn't contain all of your posts, it may also have some pagination meta.
        Parameters:
        campaignID - the ID for the campaign
        pageSize - the number of posts to request
        cursor - the next cursor from the pagination meta
        Returns:
        a list of posts from the campaign
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request fails

        Returns a post specified by it's ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a post specified by it's ID

        java.io.IOException - if the request fails
